sentence.text: He stopped himself for a moment after his lips had uttered the words .
Doreen 's lip curled sneeringly as she uttered the word .
She put her hand to her mouth , uttered a mourning cry and ran through the swing door to her car .
They uttered unfamiliar words , exchanging for their long-held tenderness their new-found passion .
She had not uttered a word during the relation of the news , nor shown any emotion .
Eugenie uttered the word while she was playing with Bryan .

The doctor was having trouble since the body was twitching and he was uttering curses about the lack of morphine .

And then she found herself wondering what had prompted her to utter remarks concerning his private affairs .
Our Government 's own advisers concur , and have been uttering increasingly urgent exhortations for change .
Luke uttered a curse under his breath and swung around , dropping Robyn 's hand , which he still held , like a stone .
In the deciduous wood a pheasant uttered its rattling call .
The priest had uttered some incoherent exclamation .
Doreen uttered a protest .
At first , he could utter only the first syllable of each name .
Similar protestations were no doubt uttered by Billy The Kid whenever he was discovered astride a corpse holding a smoking gun .
Phonemes which are uttered by the articulatory action of the same vocal organ .
He meant to give her an emphatic no , but the word was never uttered .
It is unlikely that most of these sentences would be uttered in a conversation or used in a meaningful text .
Before she could utter the cry of alarm which rose in her throat his hand had closed over her mouth , and Paige 's startled eyes blinked at him over the top .
ABDELATIF AREBEYAT walks slowly on to the podium , utters a Koranic greeting and opens a new day of business in the Jordanian parliament .

It was music to a Scotsman 's ears when he said he owed everyone in Scotland a drink , but many were sure it was only an empty promise uttered in the heat of the moment .
